text: <extra_id_0> Prolactin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and interleukin-2 receptors in T lymphocytes signal through a MGF-STAT5-like transcription factor .

The cell surface receptors for <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are structurally distinct , but share regulatory tasks in T lymphocytes .
They can stimulate proliferation and activate transcription of over - lapping sets of genes of T cells .
PRL and IL-2 receptor activation are both linked to the Jak / Stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) pathway .
We investigated the ability of <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to activate Stat proteins in different T cell lines .

The DNA binding specificities , the reactivities toward Stat - specific antisera , and the mol wt of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced DNA - binding proteins in Nb2 and C196 T cell lines were investigated .

A comparison with the Stat proteins induced by <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in T47D mammary tumor cells was made .
We found that these parameters were indistinguishable for one of the <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced factors .

A transcription factor closely related to mammary gland factor-Stat5 is rapidly activated upon interaction of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with their respective receptors .
Activation of a second protein related to Stat1 was also observed .

Our results emphasize the role of <extra_id_0> PRL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as a regulator of the immune response and indicate that the Stat factors mammary gland factor-Stat5 and Stat1 play a role in the regulation of gene expression during T cell development .
